pageContext.claim: “It's tremendously expensive because now you're dealing with schools, you're dealing with medical, you're dealing with everything. Look at California what they're doing. What they're doing is incredible. They're inviting everybody to come in. People are heading to California. California can't pay their bills already.”
pageContext.analysis: Some analysts say illegal immigration over time may even result in the net gain for the United States. Over 75 years, each immigrant represents $259,000 in net present value for federal, state and local governments, according to a 2016 report by National Academies on the economic impact of the U.S. immigration system.
